Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

If user has only 2 tabs open, and clicks almost at the speed of a double click the "X" on the left one, both tabs will close, resulting in Firefox closing.

Reproducible: Couldn't Reproduce

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open 2 tabs
2. Hover mouse over left tab's "x" (close button)
3. Click twice, just a little slower than a normal double click.
Actual Results:  
Firefox closed.

Expected Results:  
The "x" close button should have disappeared faster. Or Firefox shouldn't be able to be closed by a tab's close button.

It could have just been a one of a time instance, but yeah, probably good to tell you.
